title: Ridiculous Match Making

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
As a purely casual player, who some times bothers to throw down 5 or 6 last minute solo queue games to hit gold, i find it a bit.... ridiculous, that when my friends and I decide to play some ranked 5's we get matched against a team far better than us. 

I personally try not to let losing bother me, but when my team of ; 3 silvers, 1 gold and an unranked, get matched against a diamond, plat, 2 golds and an unranked, and our team has the higher MMR, its a joke. 
Trying to play a ''game'' isnt fun when some diamond is ball deep in my pleb ass, im too tight for that crap. rito plz. 

Adjust ranked team queues to include solo queue rank to some degree, please.

replies.body:
I also made a thread about it as i didnt see yours. This is happening to me too. The matchmaking system needs to be tweaked and its been doing this to me since 4.2 patch. This isnt in ranked games because at the moment im just playing normals.

Look at this matchmaking. It was a duo of myself and my friend who is level 16

http://i.imgur.com/oJzLKun.jpg

It does, it just presumes the best out of all of you.

It's kinda like when you first played ranked. I don't personally know what happened to you, but when I got into ranked, I was placed far higher than my actual skill level (Placed near Silver, dropped to Bronze 3). I fed in most of my games after placements and was really disheartened, though eventually I was playing with people of my skill level and really got back into the game.

Basically, my point is, MMR for new players is adjusted slightly higher than usual. The same applies to a new team. There's probably some reasoning behind it, but for the moment, you can just try your best to beat players who are better than you. After all, what's the point of playing if your victory is always secured?
